answers.author: Theodore Voorhees
answers.text:
Kim:  The City of Durham has been working on our new strategic plan for some months now.  I will ask our project manager, Jay Reinstein to contact you with answers to your questions.
Ted Voorhees, Deputy City Manager

answers.author: Peter Hames
answers.text:
The seminal text is John Bryson's book on public sector strategic planning.  It's both theory and practice, an invaluable resource for serious strategic planning.  The folks in Goodyear would do well to invest the time to read the book.  In the alternative, check this site (http://www.nd.edu/~adminoff/taskforce/10steps.htm), perhaps it's closer to answering your request.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Goodyear, AZ is interested in any resources you may have regarding example Project Plans that outlines steps, necessary resources, and potential time frames for creating a municipal strategic plan.  The city is exploring creating a new strategic plan, but as part of the proposal, we need to give executive management a high-level overview of the process, i.e. how much time this may take to complete, what type of resources (staff, fiscal) this type of undertaking would involve, key tasks and milestones, etc. 
I am looking for an example project plan that you may have that we can use.  Thanks in advance for any assistance you can provide!
Kim Bradford
Executive Management Assistant
Deputy City Manager's Office
City of Goodyear - All-America City
623.882.7073
Kim.Bradford@goodyearaz.gov
title: Strategic Plans
